page.title: 01GAZETEER
page.content: N.W. Bury St. Edmunds and District. This block is mainly arable, consisting of large fields intensively cultivated. More land is covered by a golf course. The eastern part of the village of Risby is included. Once a small community round a green, it has increasingly become a dormitory. Westley, a village with a population of 150 is also included. Here, round St. Mary's Church some very expensive houses have been built. Northwest Bury St. Edmunds consists largely of post-1960 houses in tree-lined roads with grass verges and a good deal of open space. There are two trading estates with warehouses and some light manufacturing. The block is bisected by the A45 trunk road and the railway.
